Generate a cross-classified sample

Source: R/sim_mixed_cc.R
sim_mixed_cc.Rd

Makes a basic cross-classified design with random intercepts for subjects and items

sim_mixed_cc(sub_n = 100, item_n = 20, grand_i = 0, sub_sd = 1,
  item_sd = 1, error_sd = 1, empirical = FALSE, seed = NULL)

Arguments

sub_n

the number of subjects
item_n

the number of items
grand_i

the grand intercept (overall mean)
sub_sd

the SD of subject random intercepts
item_sd

the SD of item random intercepts
error_sd

the SD of the error term
empirical

Should the returned data have these exact parameters? (versus be sampled from a population with these parameters)
seed

a single value, interpreted as an integer, or NULL (see set.seed)

Value

a tbl

Examples


sim_mixed_cc(10, 10)
#>     sub_id item_id            y grand_i       sub_i      item_i          err
